lead_paragraph: A significant drop in children apprehended at the border springs from Mexico’s record number of deportations of minors traveling without a guardian, according to the Pew Research Center.

headline.print_headline: Fewer Children Are Entering U.S. Illegally as Mexico Cracks Down
headline.main: Fewer Children Are Entering U.S. Illegally as Mexico Cracks Down, Analysis Finds

snippet: A significant drop in children apprehended at the border springs from Mexico’s record number of deportations of minors traveling without a guardian, according to the Pew Research Center.
abstract: Pew Research Center analysis finds that sharp drop in number of children attempting to enter United States illegally is due to Mexico's crackdown on such immigrants traveling without guardians as they flee violence in Central American countries.
